page_analysis.text_content:
Detached garages/carports site planning

• Detached garages and carports may be located in the rear or interior side yard if at least 75'
from the front lot line and at least 20' from the street-side lot line.
• Additionally, on lots less than 95' deep, they may be located in rear or interior side yards if
placed in rear half of the lot.
• Garages and carports that take advantage of this setback exception are subject to a stricter
daylight plane. See Figs 25-26 p. 32.

Fig 34 Examples of site planning solutions for detached garages/carports

Garages at the lot line must
comply with Uniform Building
Code (UBC) requirements for
fire-rated walls & roof materials.

3'
min.

Carports with open sides
must be at least 3' from any
lot line.

visual_elements.description: A large diagram illustrating three different site planning solutions for detached garages and carports. Each solution shows a lot layout with a main dwelling, a garage/carport, and designated areas like front yard, rear yard, interior-side yard, street-side yard, and buildable area. Cars are depicted in driveways and within the parking structures. Dimensions and setback requirements are indicated with arrows and text.
visual_elements.location: Middle to bottom of the page

visual_elements.description: A legend explaining the symbols and line types used in the site planning diagram. It includes entries for Curb, Lot line, Sidewalk, Required setbacks, Buildable area, Dwelling, Parking structure, No-parking area, and Uncovered space.

sections: Bullet point list of rules for detached garages/carports placement
Fig 34 Examples of site planning solutions for detached garages/carports
Note: Uncovered spaces must be located beyond the required front-yard and beyond the first 10' of the street-side yard.
Note: In all the examples on this page, a 1-car garage could be substituted for a 2-car garage because there is room for uncovered parking in the driveway.
A 2-car garage w/uncovered spaces in driveway (tandem OK)

additional_notes: Page number '39' is present at the bottom right corner.
The text '3' min.' appears twice in the diagram, once for garages at lot line and once for carports with open sides.
The text 'Min. 75' or midpoint for lots < 95' deep' appears three times in the diagram, indicating a common rule for the buildable area boundary.
